litw-template-title: Are you a low or high context communicator?
litw-study-title: Are you a low context communicator or a high context communicator?
litw-study-description-p1: This LabintheWild test will tell you about your communication style and how this can affect your interpretation of online messages.
litw-study-description-p2: The test takes around 5-7 minutes to complete.
litw-irb2-header: Before we get started, here are a few things you should know...
litw-irb2-q1: What is this study all about?
litw-irb2-a1-p1: In this study, you'll be able to find out how your cultural background influences how you use and see technology. By doing this research, we hope to improve access to digital technology for diverse people. Our research is supported by the National Science Foundation.
litw-irb2-a1-p2: We’ll ask you questions about your demographics, experiences, and about your decision-making. You can then see how you compare to other people around the world! Altogether, this will take around
litw-irb2-q2: What data are we going to collect?
litw-irb2-a2: We will not collect your name and contact information. However, we will collect the city and country you are located in, what browser you are using, your answers to our questions, and data about how you use our website. We will securely store this data.
litw-irb2-q3: Do I have to be in this study?
litw-irb2-a3: No, being in this study is up to you. You can leave now or at any time later.
litw-irb2-q4: Who you can contact if you have questions?
litw-irb2-a4-p1: If you have questions or concerns, you may contact Professor Katharina Reinecke, Paul G. Allen Center for Computer Science & Engineering, Box 352350, Seattle, WA 98195, reinecke@cs.washington.edu.
litw-irb2-a4-p2: If you want to talk about the study with someone who is not part of the study team, contact the University of Washington Human Subjects Division at: hsdinfo@uw.edu or 206.543.0098. (for international calls include the US Calling Code: +1-206-543-0098).
litw-irb2-consent: I agree to participate in this research.
litw-irb-warning: You must check the box to continue.
litw-demographics-title: Please tell us a little bit about yourself.
litw-demographics-required: To proceed, please properly answer all fields below. (The ones marked with * are mandatory.)
litw-demographics-title-tip: We need this information for data analysis. Please note that none of the answers are personally identifiable. We take your privacy very seriously. You may email us at info@labinthewild.org for more information.
litw-demographics-minor-alert1: Sorry, we currently do not have approval from our Institutional Review Board to conduct this study with minors younger than 14 years old.
litw-demographics-minor-alert2: In five seconds, we're redirecting you to our home page where you can participate in other studies.
litw-demographics-retake: Have you taken this test before?
litw-demographics-age: How old are you? (Please type in a number.)
litw-demographics-education: What is your highest level of formal education?
litw-demographics-education4: Incomplete secondary school or high school
litw-demographics-education5: Complete secondary school or high school
litw-demographics-country: What country are you from? (If you have lived in several countries, please indicate the country you have lived in longest.)
litw-demographics-country-grow: Which country did you live the longest growing up?
litw-demographics-country-live: Which country do you currently live in?
litw-demographics-culture: Which country is most representative of your cultural background?
litw-demographics-culture-tip: For most people, this will be the country they were born in and probably still live in.
litw-demographics-race-islander: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
litw-demographics-religion: What religion or religious denomination do you belong to?
litw-study-quest1-title: Let’s start with some questions! How much do you agree with the following questions?
litw-study-quest1-q1: Listeners should be able to understand what a speaker is trying to express, even when the speaker does not say everything they intend to communicate.
litw-study-quest1-q2: Speakers should not expect listeners will figure out what they really mean unless the intended message is stated precisely.
litw-study-quest1-q3: A listener should understand the intent of the speaker from the way the person talks.
litw-study-quest1-q4: It is better to risk saying too much than be misunderstood.
litw-study-quest1-q5: It is more important to state a message efficiently than with great detail.
litw-study-quest2-q1: Even if not stated exactly, a speaker’s intent will rarely be misunderstood.
litw-study-quest2-q2: The intended content of the message is more important than how a message is communicated.
litw-study-quest2-q3: People should be able to understand the meaning of a statement by reading between the lines.
litw-study-quest2-q4: Intentions not explicitly stated can often be inferred from the context.
litw-study-quest2-q5: A speaker can assume that listeners will know what they really mean.
litw-study-quest3-q1: People understand many things that are left unsaid.
litw-study-quest3-q2: Fewer words can often lead to better understanding.
litw-study-quest3-q3: The context in which a statement is made conveys as much or more information than the message itself.
litw-study-quest3-q4: Misunderstandings are more often caused by the listener’s failure to draw reasonable inferences, rather than the speaker’s failure to speak clearly.
litw-study-quest3-q5: You can often convey more information with less words.
litw-study-quest4-q1: Some ideas are better understood when left unsaid.
litw-study-quest4-q2: The meaning of a statement often turns more on the context than actual words.
litw-study-scenario-title: Now let’s have a look at some online messages. For each exchange you'll see a sequence of messages and rate them individually.
litw-study-scenario-prompt: The following exchange will be between:
litw-study-scenario1-subprompt: A worker and a coworker they've known for a long time
litw-study-scenario2-subprompt: A worker and a coworker they just started working with
litw-study-scenario4-subprompt: A worker and their new coworker at the company
litw-study-quest5-title: An exchange between a worker and a coworker they've known for a long time
litw-study-quest5-subprompt: Please rate the message on the following categories:
litw-study-quest6-title: An exchange between a worker and a coworker they've known for a long time
litw-study-quest6-subprompt: Please rate the entire exchange on the following categories:
litw-study-quest7-title: A worker and someone they just started working with
litw-study-quest7-subprompt: Please rate the entire exchange on the following categories:
litw-study-quest8-title: A worker and someone they just started working with
litw-study-quest8-subprompt: Please rate the entire exchange on the following categories:
litw-study-quest9-title: A worker and someone they just started working with
litw-study-quest9-subprompt: Please rate the entire exchange on the following categories:
litw-study-quest12-title: A worker and a new coworker at the company
litw-study-quest13-title: A worker and a new coworker at the company
litw-study-quest14-title: A worker and a new coworker at the company
litw-study-quest5-q1: How polite do you think the message is?
litw-study-quest5-q2: How formal do you think the message is?
litw-study-quest5-q3: How comfortable would you be SENDING this message?
litw-study-quest5-q4: How comfortable would you be RECEIVING this message?
study-results-header1-low: You tend to be a LOW context communicator!
study-results-header2-low: According to cultural anthropologist Edward Hall, this means you tend to be used to and prefer communication that is explicit and direct. It also means that you are more likely to be okay with less formal and less polite communication on Slack.
study-results-header1-high: You tend to be a HIGH context communicator!
study-results-header2-high: According to cultural anthropologist Edward Hall, this means you tend to be used to and prefer communication that is implicit and indirect. It also means that you are more likely to be okay with more formal and more polite communication on Slack.
study-results-explanation: *Average country scores for looseness and tightness are based on Xiaoxu Yang's research (see references). This survey is taken from Rieko Murata Richardson's research (see references).
study-results-explanation2_1-low: Your answers also suggest that you perceive low context, direct online messages as more appropriate than high context, indirect ones.
study-results-explanation2_2-low: This could mean that you may find it more difficult to interpret written messages that can lack any contextual cues, such as non-verbal gestures, silences, or facial expressions.
study-results-explanation2_1-high: Your answers also suggest that you perceive high context, indirect online messages as more appropriate than low context, direct ones.
study-results-explanation2_2-high: This could mean that you may find it more easy to interpret written messages that can lack any contextual cues, such as non-verbal gestures, silences, or facial expressions.
litw-results-ref-p1: [1] Hall, Edward T. Beyond culture. Anchor, 1976.
litw-results-ref-p2: [2] Richardson, Rieko Maruta and Sandi W. Smith. “The influence of high/low-context culture and power distance on choice of communication media: Students’ media choice to communicate with Professors in Japan and America.” International Journal of Intercultural Relations 31 (2007): 479-501.
litw-results-ref-p3: [3] Yang, Xiaoxu. The influence of high/low context culture on choice of communication media : students’ media choice to communicate with professors in China and the United States. (2016).
litw-comment-subtitle: Before you continue to your results, please let us know what you thought of the study!
litw-comment-q1: Do you have any comments for the researcher? Questions, Suggestions, or Concerns?
litw-comment-q21: Did you encounter any technical difficulties during this study?
litw-comment-q31: Did you cheat or in any way provide false information?
litw-comment-email-p1: You can also email us at
litw-more-title: If you enjoyed this study, there's more!
litw-more-step1: Visit and follow us on Facebook to learn about new studies:
litw-more-step2: Share this study with your friends!
litw-more-step3: And consider participating in some of our other studies:
litw-more-study1-slogan: How well can AI understand your speech?
litw-more-study1-description: Find out how well AI can understand your speech by reading out loud a few words and sentences! The test takes around 7 minutes.
litw-more-study2-slogan: Learn to be a better writer!
litw-more-study2-description: Can you identify the writing strategies of experts? Improve your reading and writing while comparing yourself to experts in this 10 minute study!
